#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Crooked Tree
#Text=Crooked Tree is a town in Belize District , Belize .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Crooked Tree is about halfway between Belize City and Orange Walk on the Northern Highway .
#Text=The exit is well marked .
#Text=You will leave the surfaced road for the packed dirt road of the causeway that leads to the village .
#Text=The distance is about 2-3 miles .
#Text=You can also take buses between Belize city and Orange Walk and get off at the Crooked Tree stop .
#Text=You will then have to walk into town .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The roads in the village are sandy and hard to drive in good conditions and awful in heavy rain , which is not uncommon .
#Text=Unless you have a 4WD vehicle
#Text=leave your car at the entrance to the village near the causeway and walk .
#Text=See
#Text=There is a visitor centre as you enter the village right after the causeway .
#Text=Be sure to stop in to get information on the local goings on .
#Text=The Crooked Tree Wildlife Sanctuary is open daily and is US$ 8 .
#Text=Where " it " is a bit hard to define but the village proper sits within the Sanctuary .
#Text=Crooked Tree 's main feature is birdwatching .
#Text=The village sits off an inland lagoon and there are hundreds of species of exotic birds to be seen with almost no effort .
#Text=Local guides can take you to the best spots to see the highest variety .
#Text=The highlight is the Jabiru stork which is the largest flying bird in the Americas .
#Text=You can also do some boating about the lagoon .
#Text=Rental prices can be high but the views are generally excellent and afford you the opportunity to see even more of the bird species .
#Text=Again , local guides are available .
#Text=Chau Hiix is a Myan site that is being excavated .
#Text=It is about a three-hour canoe to trip each way from the village .
#Text=When they are about , usually the dry season , on-site archealogists can give you a tour .
#Text=Do
#Text=During the first week of May , Crooked Tree has the annual Cashew Festival .
#Text=the village grows a lot of cashews and during this festival to mark the start of harvest they put on quite a show .
#Text=Cashews are turned into a variety of products including juice , jelly , and cakes .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Bird 's Eye View Lodge offers home cooked meals , you will eat in the kitchen , for US$10-$ 12 .
#Text=There is no menu selection
#Text=you will get some sort of chicken or fish dusted with a local spice mix with fried plantains , rice and black beans typically .
#Text=Very hearty and good .
#Text=Crooked Tree Lodge has a restaurant with a friendly and family feel .
#Text=They cater mainly for their guests , however if your not staying with them call Mick or Angie ( 626 3820 or 623 5035 ) .
#Text=Or just pop down check it out and book in for the meal of your choice .
#Text=Prices are very reasonable at US$ 10 for breakfast and lunch , and dinner is US$ 15 .
#Text=Lodge speciality meals include barbecue roast topside of beef , Tilapia and shrimp bake in spicy sweet sauce , rotisserie roast chicken , Fresh salads served with grilled fish or chicken .
#Text=Drink
#Text=The patio on the roof of the Bird 's Eye View Lodge is an excellent place to take in a drink and to watch the wildlife on the lagoon as the sun sets .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Bird 's Eye View Lodge , ☏ +501-203-2040 .
#Text=Sits about 50 feet ( 15 m ) from the lagoon .
#Text=The lagoon gets a lot closer if it rains so be sure and park well away from the water 's edge .
#Text=Rates are reasonable at US$40-$ 80 .
#Text=The rooms are clean but a bit spartan .
#Text=A/C is not in all rooms and the heat and humidity can be a bit much if you are not used to sleeping without it in the tropics .
#Text=The staff is very friendly .
#Text=There are signs pointing you to the Lodge and everyone in the village knows the location anyways .
#Text=The roads to the lodge are poor , at best , and any heavy rain will render them impassable to anything less than a 4WD .
#Text=Even then , typical rental cars like the Suzuki Grand Vitara have gotten stuck in the roads .
#Text=The Lodge takes all major credit cards .
#Text=Crooked Tree Lodge , Tree Village , Belize District , ☏ +5016263820 , ✉ contact@crookedtreelodgebelize.com .
